title: Real Madrid defender enters final phase of recovery even as uncertainty looms over role
description: According to a report from AS, Ferland Mendy is entering the final stage of his recovery, and his return to action for Real Madrid now appears close.¬†While the physical outlook is encouraging, the ou...
fullText:
According to a report from AS, Ferland Mendy is entering the final stage of his recovery, and his return to action for Real Madrid now appears close.

While the physical outlook is encouraging, the outlet mentions that questions remain over how Alvaro Arbeloa plans to use the defender once he is fully fit.

Within the club, the main objective is to avoid any kind of relapse, as after a difficult spell on the sidelines, the focus is understandably on a careful and controlled return.

Despite the caution, the overall mood around Mendy‚Äôs recovery is positive, and there is growing optimism that he will soon be back in the squad.

The current plan is for Mendy to be included in the matchday list for the upcoming trip to Valencia at Mestalla.

However, there is no expectation that he will start the match and the idea is to reintroduce him gradually, allowing him to build rhythm and confidence without taking unnecessary risks.

Once he is fully available, he will have to compete for his place like everyone else in the squad.

Ferland Mendy is close to returning. (Photo by Aitor Alcalde/Getty Images)

The uncertainty surrounding his role is linked to a wider issue at left-back. What once looked like a well-covered position has now become a tactical puzzle.

Even when natural options such as Fran Garcia and Alvaro Carreras have been available, Arbeloa has at times opted to use Eduardo Camavinga in that role.

In Arbeloa‚Äôs system, the full-backs often move into central areas during build-up, effectively acting as auxiliary midfielders.

In that context, a player like Camavinga fits the profile. His ability on the ball and comfort in central zones make him a natural choice for that hybrid role.

However, the selection choices also suggest a deeper issue, which is a possible lack of confidence in the specialist left-backs.

The repeated preference for a midfielder in that position points to doubts within the coaching staff about the reliability of the natural options.

With Mendy now approaching full fitness, his return will add another name to the competition, but it remains to be seen whether he will reclaim a regular starting spot or face the same uncertainty as the others.

title: Report: Bayern Munich gave 2027 release clause to Dayot Upamecano, might have bid against itself
description: Did FC Bayern cave in to Dayot Upamecano‚Äôs release clause demand?
fullText:
According to a report from transfer expert Fabrizio Romano, Bayern Munich center-back Dayot Upamecano might not have had as many serious suitors as previous reports indicated.

Just days before Upamecano agreed to signed a new deal (the official signing and announcement is pending), the Frenchman was linked to Liverpool, Chelsea, Tottenham, Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Inter Milan, but that reporting might have been ambitious. Per Romano, Real Madrid did not even make a bid:

üö®üîê Dayot Upamecano will formally sign soon his new deal at Bayern until June 2030.

Exclusive story on new deal accepted, 100% confirmed, Upa‚Äôs ready to put pen to paper.

There will be release clause + many clubs were keen, no bid from Real Madrid

X account @iMiaSanMia summarized Romano‚Äôs YouTube video and added more context to Romano‚Äôs X post where he stated that only Paris Saint-Germain and an unnamed English club showed ‚Äúconcrete interest‚Äù in Upamecano:

Two clubs showed concrete interest in Dayot Upamecano: PSG and one English club. Real Madrid explored the possibility but there were no concrete proposals. But in the end Upamecano decided to stay at FC Bayern. The release clause included in the new contract will be valid from summer 2027.

Throughout the process, there was a mountain of reporting ‚Äî some good, some bad. If true, this paints a different picture of what Upamecano was really looking at, which might have been no formal bids and just two clubs outside of Bayern Munich willing to discuss his big contract demands.

However, the biggest news from Romano is about the release clause, which he is saying will be active in 2027. Romano did not include the fee attached to it, but previous rumors indicated it would be ‚Ç¨60 million to ‚Ç¨65 million.

As a reminder, there has been no official conformation of the release clause or its fee, but Bayern Munich does not typically divulge contractual details.

title: Texas A&M baseball will hold an open scrimmage on Saturday afternoon
description: Texas A&M fans can get an early look at the 2026 baseball team during an open scrimmage this Saturday.
fullText:
Texas A&M will open the 2026 baseball season next Friday night against Tennessee Tech, as second-year head coach Michael Early will look to rebound after his inaugural campaign took a massive dive during the latter part of the 2025 regular season, including SEC bottom-dweller Missouri sweeping the Aggies at home in dramatic fashion.

Just months after the 2025 season came to an end, Earley went to work to retain key players on the roster, and while NIL deals likely played a big role, star hitters Caden Sorrell, Gavin Grahovac, and standout freshman Terrence Kiel will all return, combined with elite transfer addition Chris Hacopian, who previously starred for the Maryland Terrapins.

However, the injury bug struck once again after it was announced that sophomore LHP Caden McCoy would miss the regular season, leaving another gaping hole on the mound, and while Shane Sdao and Weston Moss look like the No. 1 and 2 options, Texas A&M pitching coach Dylan Olsonawski will have his work cut out for him as soon as the season begins.

While the season is a little over a week away, it was announced on Tuesday night that the Aggies will hold an open scrimmage on Saturday afternoon at Blue Bell Park, beginning at 1 p.m. Provided by GigEm247 beat writer Carter Karels, here are the details for the event.

Texas A&M baseball will hold an open scrimmage at Blue Bell Park this Saturday, beginning at 1 p.m. Details below: pic.twitter.com/FIuIcVv5D0

title: Sixers' VJ Edgecombe explains his confidence after win over Warriors
description: Philadelphia 76ers rookie VJ Edgecombe explains his confidence after a road win over the Golden State Warriors.
fullText:
SAN FRANCISCO -- Shortly after helping the Philadelphia 76ers knock off the Golden State Warriors 113-94 on Tuesday for the team's fifth-straight win, rookie guard VJ Edgecombe sat at his locker smiling. This comes after yet another impressive performance for one of the gam's dynamic young guards.

A night after shooting just 1-for-11 in Monday's win over the Los Angeles Clippers to start the team's 5-game road trip, Edgecombe had 25 points on 11-for-20 shooting against the Warriors. There was nothing coach Steve Kerr and Co. could do against the No. 3 overall pick as he made sure the Sixers were in the best position to win the game.

With that being said, the fact that Edgecombe was able to shake off such a tough performance in LA was an impressive showing. Yes, the Warriors are a scuffling group a bit, but the rookie continues to make strides.

"I'm gonna be honest, I just flushed it," Edgecombe said. "Last night, I just missed a bunch of open shots. It happens. It happens to everybody. Not every night you gonna make all the shots. Last night (Monday), I was 1-for-11. I missed 10 shots. I was like, 'You know what? I'm not gonna sit here and soak in it, I'm not gonna mope around.' My teammates have extra faith in me, and they literally told me tonight, 'You're due for a good game.'"

The rookie guard is a relentless worker. He has a thirst to be great and it's shown on a nightly basis. The Sixers also have real faith in him that he can get going no matter what is going on. The confidence from his team along with the confidence he already has in himself makes him a tough kid.

"I trust my work," Edgecombe said. "I know I work hard. It's just confidence. It's all confidence. I got my teammates, especially. Once your teammates are trusting you, man, I feel like we can just go out there and go hoop. I don't even have to worry about anything. I don't have to worry if they care if you miss it, you know what I'm saying? At the end of the day, it's a team game. They know I'm gonna make the right plays. Yeah, they just have a ton of faith in me, and I just go out there and go hoop."

Edgecombe and the Sixers will now head back to Los Angeles to face the Lakers on Thursday.

This article originally appeared on Sixers Wire: Sixers' VJ Edgecombe explains his confidence after win over Warriors

title: The CFP announces dates and locations and its not great
description: The college football world found out what the College Football Playoff schedule will look like the next few seasons, and its not the best.
fullText:
There is a common angst among college football fans with the College Football Playoff, the length of the grind and for teams like Notre Dame, they‚Äôve had to adjust much of what they do to get to the end.

Last season, the Irish and Ohio State, and this year with Indiana and Miami, saw their seasons conclude almost two months after the regular season ended. The hope was that the CFP committee would make some adjustments to the schedule, but as we found out on Tuesday, that won‚Äôt be the case.

According to multiple sources, the quarterfinal games for 2026 will be played on Dec. 30th and Jan. 1st, and then just over two weeks later the semifinals will be played. The scheduled is very similar for the 2027 season as well, and it just doesn‚Äôt feel like college football.

As Josh Pate pointed out, Saturday, Nov. 14th is the midpoint of the ‚Äúseason‚Äù which is crazy to think about. There is no need for such a large gap, and I personally hate that these games aren‚Äôt played on Saturday‚Äôs. Sure, contending with the NFL isn‚Äôt a great idea, but college football has plenty of history playing on Saturday‚Äôs. The long layoffs are unnecessary as well, as players are accustomed to just a week to prepare for the next game.

Hopefully some changes will be made going forward, but for at least the next two seasons, the CFP schedule will be long and drawn out.

Upcoming College Football Playoff dates for the quarterfinals and semi-finals the next two years. This includes a near two-week break between the quarterfinals and semi-finals the next two years. pic.twitter.com/8E7lNBDW85

‚Äî Pete Thamel (@PeteThamel) February 3, 2026

Contact/Follow us¬†@IrishWireND¬†on X (Formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Notre Dame news, notes, and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Fighting Irish Wire: The CFP announces dates and locations for ‚Äò26 & ‚Äò27 and its not great

title: 'Lessons need to be learned, and quickly' for Hearts
description: Hearts can have no complaints.  Miguel Freckelton's late header, fired beyond Alex Schwolow to seal a deserved St Mirren victory, merely underlined what had been apparent long before the final whistle.  When Derek McInnes sits down to analyse this one there will be no shortage of moments to rewind, slow down and scrutinise.
fullText:
Miguel Freckelton's late header, fired beyond Alex Schwolow to seal a deserved St Mirren victory, merely underlined what had been apparent long before the final whistle.

From the opening exchanges Hearts looked off the pace. Even allowing for some admirable, at times heroic, defending after being reduced to ten men, few inside the ground could argue with the outcome of the game.

When Derek McInnes sits down to analyse this one there will be no shortage of moments to rewind, slow down and scrutinise. The decisive goal itself was born from a catalogue of errors that will irritate the Hearts manager far more than the final scoreline.

Should the initial cross that led to the corner have been blocked? Did Schwolow really need to push a ball that appeared to be drifting wide behind? Why was a six-foot-plus defender allowed to run unchallenged from the back post to the front and meet the header? And more broadly, where was the composure at the back that ultimately led to Craig Halkett's dismissal?

These questions - and several others - will be picked over forensically in the coming days. Lessons will need to be learned, and quickly.

But perspective matters. This was only Hearts' third defeat over 90 minutes all season. Offered that return last summer, anyone connected with the club would have snapped your hand off.

There is no reason for panic, no need for melodrama. Instead, there is an opportunity because next comes the perfect response game. Hibernian at Tynecastle. Under the floodlights. With scrutiny dialled all the way up and the footballing world watching.

The question will be asked loudly and repeatedly: do Hearts really have what it takes to go all the way in the Premiership title race?

title: Longhorns Daily News: Is Steve Sarkisian‚Äôs seat really ‚Äòwarming‚Äô after missing CFP?
description: The way of the college football world today breaks down to this: coaches don‚Äôt get many opportunities to screw up, and anything short of a national championship is considered a screw up. So, given that current logic, it‚Äôs no surprise that the Houston Chronicle recently published a column noting that Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The way of the college football world today breaks down to this: coaches don‚Äôt get many opportunities to screw up, and anything short of a national championship is considered a screw up. So, given that current logic, it‚Äôs no surprise that the Houston Chronicle recently published a column noting that Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian sits atop a steadily warming hot-ish seat after the Longhorns missed the College Football Playoff last season.

From the Chronicle: ‚ÄúSteve Sarkisian is not on any hot seat by a long shot. Not after going 35-8 the past three years (with two of the losses in the College Football Playoff semifinals and three other losses to Georgia and, oh yeah, Florida). He reached the CFP two of the previous three seasons and barely missed this past season. But he‚Äôs on the warming seat. And he‚Äôs got company. Sarkisian is preparing for his sixth season at Texas after seeing 26 of his players transfer out and 19 transfer in, including the portal‚Äôs top-ranked wide receiver, two outstanding running backs and two elite linebackers. The big number of those leaving suggest Texas badly missed its evaluations on more than two dozen players or drastically upgraded all of those positions. Actually, both of those premises could be true. Sarkisian at least grasps the sense of urgency among Longhorn Nation because this isn‚Äôt a place where you want to miss the playoff two years in a row. But he‚Äôs not alone. I‚Äôd say the top five coaches with the most heat on them, in order, are Alabama‚Äôs Kalen DeBoer, Oregon‚Äôs Dan Lanning, Sarkisian, LSU‚Äôs Lane Kiffin and USC‚Äôs Lincoln Riley. None of these obviously are in a must-win situation like some others. ‚Ä¶ Those on the hottest of hot seats are Baylor‚Äôs Dave Aranda (three losing seasons in the past four years), Florida State‚Äôs Mike Norvell (coming off 2-10 and 5-7 seasons), Wisconsin‚Äôs Luke Fickell (16-21 over three years), Maryland‚Äôs Mike Locksley (1-8 in Big Ten two straight years) and South Carolina‚Äôs Shane ‚ÄúDid you see our first half against the Aggies?‚Äù Beamer. ‚Ä¶ Of the group needing to break through and avoid slipping backward, they just need to win big and dispel the notion that they have hit a wall and have to get past it. DeBoer, it says here, is the best coach in the nation not named Kirby Smart, Curt Cignetti or Ryan Day, yet a large percentage of Crimson Tide fans think his days might be numbered if a third year isn‚Äôt more successful after missing the CFP in Year 1 and winning one CFP game over an average Oklahoma team in Year 2. Lanning has been a borderline disaster in the CFP, getting squashed by Ohio State in 2024 and mauled by Indiana in 2025 (after dominating Texas Tech). Kiffin may or may not have a honeymoon in his first season at Baton Rouge, but he‚Äôs still not been on the sidelines for a CFP game yet in his career. Riley can sure develop a quarterback or two with Caleb Williams and Jayden Maiava, but when is the breakthrough season coming? Lots of urgency in 2026.‚Äú

Who? You‚Äôre forgiven for being unfamiliar with an extremely young arm who hasn‚Äôt yet gotten out of rookie ball, but our No. 77 prospect a year ago (then a starter, repeating the DSL and killing it) made a successful adjustment Stateside. He‚Äôll return to starting in 2026, likely getting his feet wet in Arizona and getting a promotion to Low-A in the second half of the season.

It‚Äôs been a slow but steady climb for this 13th-rounder in 2023. The good news here is, with the caveat that Galanie has always competed older than his level, Galanie has found some footing. While his power/slugging numbers are merely OK, he drove in 94 runs in 2025. He disappeared a bit in the playoffs for Birmingham (just four hits in six games, with five walks as well) but started every game in the march to a second consecutive Southern League title for the Barons.

The 2025 season was an utter disaster for Iriarte, who went from prospective South Side rotation member to lost in space. The righty, who made his brief debut in the majors in 2024, both lost the plate and misplaced his strikeout power. The Brian Bannister Pitching Lab has its work cut out here, for sure.

While still young for his level and managing to keep his head above water in a new league every season of his career, Mogoll√≥n‚Äôs undeniable hitting in Rookie ball fell off significantly with the Cannon Ballers. Rodriguez is a rare DSL pitcher, not for his relatively light innings load, but as a primary starter ‚Äî and at just 17 years old (Yobal turns 18 on February 9). title: Where LSU women's basketball ranks in latest USA TODAY Coaches Poll
description: LSU women's basketball is riding high. Where do Kim Mulkey and the Tigers rank in the latest USA TODAY Sports Coaches Poll?
fullText:
LSU women's basketball took care of business with three wins over the last week. Its consistency was reflected in the latest edition of the USA TODAY Coaches Poll, released Tuesday.

The Tigers remained at No. 5 in this week's poll. The top stayed the same with UConn, UCLA, South Carolina and Texas going one through four. Vanderbilt, after suffering its second-consecutive loss this week, dropped two spots to No. 8. Louisville and Michigan each climbed to No. 6 and 7, respectively.

LSU returned to the PMAC on January 26 for three straight home games last week. It defeated Florida, Arkansas and Alabama each by over 20 points. Sunday against Alabama, LSU exploded in the second half for a 40-point win. The Crimson Tide fell to No. 23 in the coaches poll.

This week, LSU has another chance to climb the rankings and boost its chances at getting a No. 1 seed in the NCAA Tournament bracketology. It travels to Austin to take on the Longhorns on Thursday, then to Auburn for a Sunday afternoon tipoff.

This article originally appeared on LSU Wire: Where LSU women's basketball ranks in latest USA TODAY Coaches Poll

title: Dalton Knecht plays five minutes for Lakers at Brooklyn
description: Former Vol Dalton Knecht by the numbers for the Lakers at Brooklyn.
fullText:
Los Angeles (30-19) defeated Brooklyn (13-36), 125-109, Tuesday at Barclays Center in Brooklyn, New York.

Former Vol Dalton Knecht totaled four points and one assist in five minutes for the Lakers. He converted 2-of-5 field goal attempts and went 0-of-2 in three-point attempts.

LeBron James scored 25 points and Luka Doncic totaled 24 points for Los Angeles.

Knecht was selected in the first round of the¬†2024 NBA draft¬†(No. 17) by the Lakers.

He transferred to Tennessee from Northern Colorado and played for the Vols during the 202cus3-24 season under head coach¬†Rick Barnes.

During his one season at Tennessee, Knecht averaged 21.7 points, 4.9 rebounds and 1.8 assists per game. He led the Vols to a SEC regular-season championship and an appearance in the NCAA Tournament Elite Eight for a second time in school history.

Los Angeles will next play¬†Thursday versus Philadelphia. Tipoff is slated for 10:30 p.m. EST at Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles. California.

Follow Vols Wire on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†X¬†(formerly Twitter).

This article originally appeared on Vols Wire: Dalton Knecht by the numbers for Lakers at Brooklyn

title: NBA: First-time All-Stars for 2025-2026 season
description: The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring a defense, or becoming indispensable to their team‚Äôs identity. Together, they represent the league‚Äôs constant evolution and the reward that comes from opportunity meeting preparation.

Deni Avdija breaks new ground as one of the league‚Äôs most complete two-way forwards this season. His All-Star nod reflects a career-high scoring uptick and unprecedented playmaking for a Trail Blazers forward, putting him among the rare players averaging 25+ points, 7+ rebounds, and 6+ assists. Beyond the counting stats, Avdija‚Äôs selection is historic: he‚Äôs the first NBA All-Star from Israel, showcasing his rapid ascent and growing global impact. His versatile game has been a key factor for Portland‚Äôs competitiveness this season.

Jalen Duren has emerged as a true interior force for the Detroit Pistons, anchoring both ends of the court with energy and efficiency. This first All-Star selection comes as a result of his elite rebounding and inside scoring, where he ranks among the league‚Äôs best in key paint-dominant metrics. Duren‚Äôs physicality sets the tone for Detroit defensively, and his offensive improvements have made him a reliable secondary scoring option. His trajectory suggests he could become one of the NBA‚Äôs premier big men for years to come.

Chet Holmgren‚Äôs All-Star breakthrough signifies the Thunder‚Äôs rise defensively and his unique impact on both ends of the floor. In just his third NBA season, he‚Äôs developed into a disruptive rim protector while continuing to expand his scoring and rebounding prowess. Holmgren‚Äôs combination of size, agility, and shooting range makes him a matchup problem and a centerpiece of OKC‚Äôs identity. His inclusion among the league‚Äôs elite this year highlights how integral he‚Äôs become to his team‚Äôs success

Back at full health after a season cut short by injury, Jalen Johnson has taken a massive leap to become one of the Hawks‚Äô central playmakers. His All-Star selection reflects career-high production across scoring, rebounding, and facilitating, with a rare all-around stat line that puts him in elite company. Johnson‚Äôs athleticism and versatility have given Atlanta a multi-dimensional threat on offense and a disruptive presence on defense. This first All-Star appearance underscores his growth into a franchise cornerstone.

Jamal Murray‚Äôs first All-Star nod comes after years of high-impact performances that previously went unrecognized in the midseason showcase. This season represents a personal best on both ends of the court, where he‚Äôs set new marks in scoring, assists, and shooting efficiency. Murray‚Äôs knack for clutch play and generating offense has been vital for the Nuggets, especially during stretches without Nikola Jokiƒá. His breakthrough honors reflect the high-level consistency he‚Äôs brought to Denver‚Äôs lineup.

At 32 years old, Norman Powell‚Äôs first All-Star selection is a testament to perseverance and gradual refinement of his game. In Miami, Powell has become a primary scoring threat, putting up career-best numbers while leading one of the highest-scoring offenses in the league. His sharpshooting and ability to take over games in isolation have made him an X-factor for the Heat. This long-awaited recognition rewards years of hard-earned development and situational excellence.

These first-time All-Stars didn‚Äôt arrive by accident; their selections reflect seasons defined by consistency, resilience, and expanded roles. From young cornerstones announcing their arrival to veterans finally receiving overdue recognition, this group captures multiple paths to All-Star status. As the league continues to shift, the 2025‚Äì26 class stands as a snapshot of the NBA‚Äôs next phase and the players shaping it.

The post NBA: First-time All-Stars for 2025-2026 season appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Resetting Iowa‚Äôs stats before late tip at Washington
description: The Iowa Hawkeyes are a top 20 team by KenPom & Bart Torvik - let‚Äôs dive into why that‚Äôs the case
fullText:
The Iowa Hawkeyes, are sitting at 16-5 & 6-4 in conference play after a convincing win at Oregon. Though the Ducks were down their two leading scorers, the Hawks played a solid game wire-to-wire, trailing just 1:39.

Ben McCollum has done something through 3 games out west, where we have seen other Hawkeye outfits struggle. Football is 0-2 in their two trips to LA while the women‚Äôs team is 0-4 across two seasons. Fran McCaffery lost two games in blowouts amidst the Palisades fire last year.

Yet Ben McCollum has them 3-0 with a solid chance at 4-0 tonight against the Washington Huskies (12-10, 4-7). Their record belies their advanced stats as both KenPom & Bart Torvik rate them in the 40s. Iowa is rated 19th by KenPom & 20th by Bart Torvik, which puts their chances tonight at ~57%.

That segues nicely into a deeper look into Iowa‚Äôs stats and how they stack up halfway through the Big Ten season. Let‚Äôs start with the most shocking stat: at 63.0 points allowed per game, Iowa ranks 4th in the NATION & tops in the conference. A big reason for that is pace ‚Äì both advanced analytic sites rank them in the bottom 20 in that respect.

But it goes further than that, as Iowa has been excellent in two areas: three-point defense & turnover %. They‚Äôre allowing opponents to make just 30% of threes on the season (28.9% in conference play). They rank 29th in the nation in that respect, and tops in the conference. Additionally, opponents are taking 37.7% of their shots from deep, which ranks in the top 3rd nationally. In conference play, their rank is 2nd at 37.3%.

Iowa‚Äôs turning teams over 22.1% of the time ‚Äì 7th in the country. Their in-conference rate is 19.9%, and tops here. Iowa‚Äôs forcing live ball turnovers 11.3% of the time in Big Ten games (once again tops in the league) and 12.1% overall.

What this combination of stats supplement when watching the games is that the Hawks simply guard harder than they have in nearly two decades. Everyone is fighting, they‚Äôre handing off screens well, they‚Äôre jumping passing lanes. Each of Bennett Stirtz, Tavion Banks, and Isaia Howard rank nationally in steal percentage, paced by Howard‚Äôs 4.3% which is 34th in the country.

A portion of this is because they have to: Iowa lacks a true rim protector right now and it shows. Teams are shooting 55.5% from 2 in conference play, ranking 16th. The activity on the perimeter is also opening Iowa up to opposing guards attacking driving lanes with aplomb. The overall mindset is all resulting in a ton of fouls ‚Äì opponent free throw rates in conference is 40.7% FTA:FGA, bottom in the league. Yuck.

Despite all that, Iowa‚Äôs defense is a top 20 outfit ‚Äì at 97.3 per KenPom & 96.7 at Bart Torvik. Only twice did Iowa‚Äôs defense under Fran McCaffery finish in the top 30 and this group would be the best according to KenPom since they finished first in the nation in 2006.

Offensively, there is little drop-off from recent Fran-led teams, with Iowa sitting at 27th in adjusted efficiency according to KenPom. Recent Fran units finished 16th and 18th after a run of top 10 units from 2019-2023.

Of course, the tip of the spear is Bennett Stirtz. He‚Äôs the type of guard Iowa has not had in a good long time. Maybe I squint and see Adam Haluska? Andre Woolridge, maybe? He‚Äôs 6th in conference both in scoring at 19.0 points/game and assists at 5.0. He‚Äôs the only guy in the top six of both category and has been an Iron Man despite fighting through some illness as the conference season ramped. His 90.1% of minutes played ranks 15th. He‚Äôs coming off his best game and if he continues playing like this‚Ä¶I like Iowa‚Äôs chances against damn near anybody.

But it‚Äôs more than him ‚Äì early in the season Ben McCollum referenced the importance of paint touches and I kind of can‚Äôt stop myself from getting excited any time someone gets in the lane. It‚Äôs almost like the equivalent of a 4-5 yard carry every run play where the offense is piling up the body blows. It‚Äôs resulted in an effective field goal percentage of 58.5% and 60.2% from 2 (9th in the country). Stirtz & Banks ‚Äì Iowa‚Äôs highest volume shooters from 2 ‚Äì are at 58.6% and 54.2%. Only Kael Combs, at 55.4% joins them under 60%. Everyone else in the rotation is above 60%.

The other value of paint touches is that it leads to kickouts on open 3s. Iowa is hitting 37.4% from deep, 29th in the nation. Howard is the lagger there, at 27.5%, but everyone else is above 37%.

Overall, it‚Äôs led to a very consistent team game-to-game. I‚Äôve kind of marveled at Iowa‚Äôs ‚ÄúGame Score‚Äù graph at Bart Torvik.

They‚Äôve got just one game below 50 ‚Äì an early season win over Western Illinois ‚Äì and a second right at 50 when they went on the road to Michigan State. Only three other games below 80, losses to Minnesota and Illinois and then the win versus Rutgers. Just a team who is very comfortable doing what they do agains almost anybody.

This was just not a level of consistency we had seen from Iowa under late stage Fran. They were far too reliant on the natural variation of basketball ‚Äì makes and misses ‚Äì and did not have the rallying cry this group does of ‚ÄúImpose Your Will.‚Äù

Of course, there are still 10 conference games left ‚Äì McCollum, the maniac referred to the games after USC as an 11-game conference tournament ‚Äì and things could fall apart. But Iowa is performing about as well as could be expected as they‚Äôre sitting in the top half of the conference at 6-4. A win tonight would put them in a tie for 7th with UCLA and a game behind Purdue and Wisconsin.

It‚Äôs a tall, and late, task but if there‚Äôs a group who will come out and play as expected ‚Äì it‚Äôs this one.

title: Juventus walk AWAY from ¬£13m deal for Liverpool forward
description: Juventus emerge as Chiesa frontrunnersRoma, AC Milan and Napoli were chief among them but owing to a combination of factors no deal could be done. Chiesa‚Äôs wage - estimated at ¬£140k per week - is t...
fullText:
Roma, AC Milan and Napoli were chief among them but owing to a combination of factors no deal could be done. Chiesa‚Äôs wage - estimated at ¬£140k per week - is too rich for most Italian clubs.

And Liverpool sporting director Richard Hughes was never going to give him away for free either. It meant Serie A sides were limited to offering only a loan deal for Chiesa - which was not appealing to Liverpool.

Chiesa stuck at it, making himself an option for Slot during the 2025/26 season.

He has provided two top-flight goals and has been a bigger presence in and around the squad. For that he deserves credit but it always looked likely that the club would entertain a January deal if the right offer was made.

Juventus came forward - with head coach Luciano Spalletti keen to work with Chiesa again following their time together in the Italian national team.

The Old Lady could offer a loan fee plus an option to buy - but even this structure wasn‚Äôt appealing enough for Liverpool to do business.

We are led to believe that Chiesa would have been open to a deal because he is seeking to reestablish himself in the Italy squad ahead of the FIFA World Cup playoffs in March.

Gaining first-team football would have no doubt aided though efforts but right now he is stuck on one start for Liverpool in the league and not reckoned to be in contention for many more.

Juve however walked away and concluded a loan deal for Nice winger Jeremie Boga instead. The finances work much better for the Turin giants - who would have been paying up to ¬£13m in a loan fee plus a permanent obligation plus wages for Chiesa.

The Euro 2020 winger has in effect been priced out of a deal and unless he can make another breakthrough under Slot he is set for a very frustrating spell on the sidelines for the second half of the campaign.

title: Honor Solomon: Man United complete signing of goalkeeper from Blackburn Rovers
description: Manchester United have signed goalkeeper Honor Solomon from Blackburn Rovers, it has been confirmed by the player‚Äôs agency.Solomon‚Äôs careerSolomon joined Blackburn Rovers in 2021, having spent eig...
fullText:
Manchester United have signed goalkeeper Honor Solomon from Blackburn Rovers, it has been confirmed by the player‚Äôs agency.

Solomon joined Blackburn Rovers in 2021, having spent eight years with United‚Äôs cross-town rivals, Manchester City.

A modern-style goalkeeper who is comfortable with the ball at his feet, Solomon also boasts sharp reflexes and confident shot-stopping.

He primarily played for Blackburn Rovers‚Äô Under-18 and Under-21 teams. This term, he has racked up six appearances across Premier League 2, the Premier League Cup and the National League Cup.

Solomon has conceded 11 goals in that period.

The 19-year-old was on the bench when Blackburn stunned United with a shocking 4-0 away win in October last year.

Solomon has gained valuable senior experience through loan moves, having spent time with Clitheroe and Atherton Collieries.

Now, it has emerged that Solomon has sealed a move to United.

The transfer has been confirmed by Solomon‚Äôs agency, Harwick Sports, on social media.

The sports agency uploaded a graphic to their Instagram page announcing that the goalkeeper is now part of United‚Äôs ranks.

They captioned the image with the message, ‚ÄúCongrats to @solhonor1 on his move to Manchester United. Big opportunity ‚Äî all the best with the next step Sol.‚Äù

According to Rich Fay of the Manchester World, Solomon is poised to provide competition at Under-21 level.

His challenge for regular minutes will see him contend with Elyh Harrison, William Murdock, and Dermot Mee. Harrison recently returned to United after being recalled from his loan spell at League Two club Shrewsbury Town.

If he excels, Solomon could well find himself competing with Senne Lammens at the first-team level.

Meanwhile, Michael Carrick and his players return to action on Saturday when they host Tottenham Hotspur at Old Trafford in the early kick-off.

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Abbott relishes Stags loan after injury setbacks
description: The Tottenham U21 midfielder is excited to get another shot at League One after an injury-hit spell at Wycombe.
fullText:
Tottenham midfielder George Abbott says he is excited to get another shot at League One with Mansfield Town after his stay with Wycombe Wanderers was cut short by injury earlier in the season.

Abbott, 20, returns to Nottinghamshire for a spell with the Stags following a successful period in League Two with Notts County in 2025, during which he scored the English Football League goal of the season.

In an interview with BBC Radio Nottingham, Tottenham's former Under-21 captain described the East Midlands as "a nice place to come back to" as he again tries to step up a division.

"I'm excited for it," he said. "I had an injury prior, so I just wanted to get back on to the pitch.

"When Mansfield came in for me, I thought it was a no-brainer."

Abbott has fond memories of his time with Stags' near neighbours Notts, marking his time there as "a good introduction to men's football" after coming through the youth-team ranks at Tottenham.

"Now coming to Mansfield in League One, and Wycombe earlier this season, I just keep stepping up and building up till hopefully I can play higher up, it's a really good stepping stone," said Abbott.

Listen to the latest Mansfield Town interviews on BBC Radio Nottingham

Mansfield agree Roberts deal and Abbott loan

Abbott joins Tottenham Under-21 teammate Oliver Irow on loan at the Stags, who has already proved popular with Mansfield fans after scoring an impressive brace on his senior debut against Port Vale in January.

The second of Irow's goals, an excellent strike into the top right corner, has already been discussed as a strong contender for goal of the season.

Abbott spoke fondly of his Spurs teammate and his early success with the Stags, yet also alluded to some playful competition between the pair and his own belief in his ability to score goals equal to Irow's debut goal.

"When I first saw him (Irow) come here at the start of the window, I was really pleased for him," he said.

"As it became more and more likely that I was coming [here] I was really looking forward to it - just for the fact he was here as well and I could settle in a lot quicker.

"Hopefully I can get back there where I am scoring those types of goals.

"For him it was an incredible start and to score two goals on his debut like that and one of them being that good, it was quite special for him.

"Hopefully I can score a similar goal to that."

title: Detroit Lions‚Äô 2025 Regression Didn‚Äôt Surprise Super Bowl Champ Devin McCourty
description: NBC analyst Devin McCourty compares the Lions‚Äô 2025 struggles to Patriots teams that dealt with coordinator turnover and explains why Detroit must adjust fast.
fullText:
The Detroit Lions didn‚Äôt suddenly forget how to play football in 2025, but according to NBC analyst and former Patriots captain Devin McCourty, they ran straight into one of the hardest realities in the NFL: coordinator turnover.

Speaking recently about Detroit‚Äôs season, McCourty said the Lions‚Äô drop-off wasn‚Äôt surprising at all. In fact, it looked painfully familiar to what he lived through during his 13-year run with the New England Patriots.

And if Lions fans are looking for a silver lining, McCourty‚Äôs message was pretty clear: this is fixable, but it‚Äôs real.

McCourty pointed to multiple moments in Patriots history when New England took a step back after losing key coordinators. Even with Tom Brady, Bill Belichick, and elite talent still in place, things didn‚Äôt always click immediately once new voices took over.

‚ÄúOne thing I‚Äôve learned,‚Äù McCourty explained, ‚Äúis when you lose coordinators, that creates so much unknown.‚Äù

He lived it firsthand. After New England won the Super Bowl in 2007, Brady‚Äôs knee injury in 2008 and the challenge of replacing offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels and defensive coordinator Dean Pees stalled the Patriots for several seasons. The roster was strong, but the rhythm wasn‚Äôt the same.

McCourty says that‚Äôs not a coincidence ‚Äî and it‚Äôs exactly what Detroit just experienced.

Detroit entered the 2025 season with new coordinators on both sides of the ball, then changed offensive play-callers midseason. Now, the Lions are preparing for yet another offensive shift in 2026 with Drew Petzing taking over play-calling duties.

From McCourty‚Äôs perspective, that kind of churn matters ‚Äî even when the scheme looks similar on paper.

‚ÄúBrian Flores didn‚Äôt call the defense the same way Matt Patricia did,‚Äù McCourty said while reflecting on New England‚Äôs own transitions. ‚ÄúYes, it was a lot of the same stuff, but it was different.‚Äù

Those subtle differences, he explained, can impact timing, confidence, communication, and ultimately results.

One key distinction McCourty made clear: the Lions‚Äô roster is not broken.

The core of Detroit‚Äôs team remains largely intact from the group that won 15 games in 2024. That matters. A lot.

In McCourty‚Äôs eyes, this wasn‚Äôt a collapse ‚Äî it was a recalibration year while players and coaches tried to adjust to new systems, new voices, and new expectations.

Still, he warned that the Lions can‚Äôt just assume things will magically snap back into place.

McCourty didn‚Äôt sugarcoat it. If the Lions want to contend for the Super Bowl in 2026, there‚Äôs work to do ‚Äî especially in establishing clarity and continuity.

New coordinators don‚Äôt just need time to install schemes. Players need to trust them. Coaches need to align. And the entire organization has to move in the same direction again.

That‚Äôs the part, McCourty says, fans often underestimate.

The good news? Detroit has the foundation. The bad news? The margin for error is smaller when expectations are sky-high.

The post Detroit Lions‚Äô 2025 Regression Didn‚Äôt Surprise Super Bowl Champ Devin McCourty appeared first on Detroit Sports Nation.

title: Bremen sign Daniel Thioune as new coach
description: Werder Bremen have signed Daniel Thioune as their new coach, the Bundesliga club said in a statement on Wednesday. He replaces Horst Steffen, who was dismissed on Sunday in the wake of 10 games without victory.
fullText:
Werder Bremen have signed Daniel Thioune as their new coach, the Bundesliga club said in a statement on Wednesday.

He replaces Horst Steffen, who was dismissed on Sunday in the wake of 10 games without victory.

The club didn't disclose contract details, such as the length of the deal.

Thioune most recently coached second-division side Fortuna Dusseldorf and hasn't worked in the Bundesliga so far. He will make his debut in the top German tier against Freiburg on Saturday.

"Our meetings with Daniel all went very well. His understanding of football, along with his character and his approach to our current sporting situation were all key factors in our decision. We are convinced that we will manage to turn things around with him in charge," head of professional football Clemens Fritz said.

Thioune added: "I'm very much looking forward to working with the team and I'm convinced that we will manage to be successful together, in order to achieve the goals that the club have set."

Bremen are 15th in the league standings, just above the relegation zone.

title: Hughes 'finds balance for me to work in ideal circumstances' - Slot
description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says the club's sporting director Richard Hughes has a "low ego" and provides "ideal circumstances" to work in with his level of involvement.  Hughes was appointed before the start of the 2024-25 season, as Slot succeeded Jurgen Klopp as head coach, and oversaw the Reds' bumper 2025 summer transfer spend of ¬£415m.  "We have spoken almost on a daily basis since we started, you get to know each other even better," Slot told an episode of 'The Reds Roundtable' published on the club's YouTube channel.
fullText:
Liverpool boss Arne Slot says the club's sporting director Richard Hughes has a "low ego" and provides "ideal circumstances" to work in with his level of involvement.

Hughes was appointed before the start of the 2024-25 season, as Slot succeeded Jurgen Klopp as head coach, and oversaw the Reds' bumper 2025 summer transfer spend of ¬£415m.

"We have spoken almost on a daily basis since we started, you get to know each other even better," Slot told an episode of 'The Reds Roundtable' published on the club's YouTube channel.

"What I really like about working for a sporting director is that whenever I need him, he is there for me. But you don't constantly feel that all the decisions you are making, he is judging them. Maybe he does but then he finds a really good way of hiding it!

"You want to have the backup when needed and advice, but you don't want two eyes on top of you constantly on every decision you make. I think Richard finds that balance really well for me to work in ideal circumstances.

"I've worked with sporting directors who are very keen on the ones they have signed and what makes Richard special is that he's not only focused on the ones he signed, he is there for Liverpool to win and not (just) for his signings to do well.

"That's something you don't always see with sporting directors. It's safe to say he has a low ego."

On finding the balance between advising, interjecting, and allowing the head coach to do his job, Hughes added: "Fundamentally, there's the understanding for both parties and everyone at wide, that everything involving matchday, team selection, tactics, that's always the manager or head coach.

"That's their domain. It's very important not to step into that.

"Of course we talk about football and performances but I always let Arne lead that. Naturally in a conversation I will come up with an opinion and not just react to Arne's, but always waiting for the right time to share these things is critical."

title: 'Gutting' Clarkson exit & 'too many unknowns'
description: Gary: It's very difficult to be optimistic as a Dons fan, really hard watching Falkirk, Hearts and Hibs who are miles ahead of us.  Too many continued loan signings that don't give the squad stability moving forward.  Loan signings don't really care about the club as they know in five months time they are potentially heading back to their own club.
fullText:
We asked for your thoughts on Aberdeen's business in the January transfer window.

Gary: It's very difficult to be optimistic as a Dons fan, really hard watching Falkirk, Hearts and Hibs who are miles ahead of us. Too many continued loan signings that don't give the squad stability moving forward. Loan signings don't really care about the club as they know in five months time they are potentially heading back to their own club. Time for change at the top.

Fred: I cannot see the window activity making us a stronger team in the short term. We have lost two creative players and signed players who have struggled for game time in their previous teams. For me the only real positive is the new goalkeeper. I hope the new and old players can quickly gel into a team.

Steve: Absolutely devastated that Leighton Clarkson has gone. What a talent, wasted this season through lack of game time. Why not put him out on loan? But to see loan players who were brought in, and let's face it, they're only here to get game time, start before you, must be demoralising despite putting the effort in on the training pitch. It will be interesting keeping tabs on him at Blackpool now. Thank you Leighton, for everything you gave to the Dons, and hopefully you'll agree, "once a Don, always a Don."

Mark: A first window for the new sporting director gets some pass marks for addressing some squad gaps and shifting some of the dead wood and expensive low impact players. This is clearly a stop gap until the summer when the real work will begin. Aberdeen remain a paper tiger.

Ian: They have left themselves a lot to do but the players need to step up now. They have let the club down badly, hopefully the new players will have a bit more fight about them.

Stuart: Disappointed the club has not signed a player that would have got the fans jumping in their seats. Too many unknowns coming in and can I just say all the best to Clarkson at Blackpool, a hugely talented player who graced Pittodrie.

title: Real Betis vs Atletico Madrid: Match preview, predicted line-ups, team news and prediction
description: Real Betis and Atletico Madrid go head-to-head for the final spot in this season‚Äôs Copa del Rey semi-finals on Thursday night.The hosts overcame fellow La Liga side Elche in the last 16, while Atlet...
fullText:
Real Betis and Atletico Madrid go head-to-head for the final spot in this season‚Äôs Copa del Rey semi-finals on Thursday night.

The hosts overcame fellow La Liga side Elche in the last 16, while Atletico narrowly edged out lower-league Deportivo.

Since lifting the trophy in 2022, Betis had not advanced beyond the Copa del Rey last 16 until this campaign, starting their run with a 7-1 demolition of Atletico Palma del Rio and building momentum from there.

Manuel Pellegrini‚Äôs side beat Torrent CF and Real Murcia in the next two rounds before coming from a goal down to defeat Elche 2-1.

After suffering back-to-back defeats for the first time this season, El Glorioso bounced back with consecutive wins over Feyenoord and Valencia, setting them up nicely for the upcoming clash with Atletico.

With only one win from the last 13 encounters, Thursday‚Äôs hosts have not fared well against their visitors, who came out on top in both of last year‚Äôs meetings by a combined score of 6-1.

Currently 10 points adrift of Barcelona in the La Liga race, Atletico will view the Spanish Cup as perhaps their best chance of silverware this season.

Diego Simeone‚Äôs side last lifted the trophy in 2013 and have fallen at the semi-final stage in each of the past two seasons.

Atletico ended 2025 with four consecutive wins, but have managed just three victories in eight outings so far in 2026.

While Los Colchoneros‚Äô goalless stalemate against Levante on Saturday was a disappointment, it extended their away unbeaten run to seven matches ahead of the trip to Andalusia.

Betis are without Rodrigo Riquelme, Giovani Lo Celso, Junior Firpo, and Hector Bellerin, all sidelined with muscle injuries.

Sofyan Amrabat and Isco are also ruled out with ankle problems, while Cucho Hernandez remains sidelined by a thigh injury.

Chimy Avila is in fine form, with four goal contributions in his last six games‚Äîincluding a brace against Elche in the previous round‚Äîmaking him one to watch.

Antoine Griezmann is set to miss a fourth straight game with a muscle issue, denying him the opportunity to add to his three cup goals so far.

New signing Ademola Lookman is also unavailable, but is expected to make his debut in Sunday‚Äôs league clash against Betis.

Real Betis Predicted XI (4-3-3): Lopez; Gomez, Natan, Llorente, Orrtiz; Altimira, Fornals, Roca; Antony, Avila, Ezzalzouli

Atletico Madrid Predicted XI (4-4-2): Oblak; Ruggeri, Hancko, Pubill, Llorente; Almada, Cardoso, Barrios, Gonzalez; Baena, Alvarez

Prediction: Real Betis 1-2 Atletico Madrid

title: How high is Notre Dame in CBS Sports early 2026 CFP projection?
description: Notre Dame has made CBS Sports way-too-early College Football Playoff projection. What seed do they think the Irish earn?
fullText:
It‚Äôs pretty safe the say that the general sentiment around college football is that Notre Dame will make its return to the College Football Playoff in 2026.

The Irish were left out of this year‚Äôs 12-team event, as many believed that they deserved to be in. After what we saw unfold, it was pretty safe to say that Notre Dame should have been in, as it very well could have won it all.

As for this coming season, CBS Sports Brad Crawford released his way-too-early CFP bracket projection, and he‚Äôs got the Irish as the No. 2 seed. Miami, one of Notre Dame‚Äôs opponents, takes the to spot, so it seems like whoever loses that game finds their footing once again. Texas and Indiana round out his top-4.

In this scenario, the Irish would take on the winner of the 7 vs. 10 matchup as Crawford has Texas A&M and Oregon battling it out in the first round. Overall, it‚Äôs an interesting take, with four Big Ten and SEC teams, Texas Tech making it again and Memphis as the Group of 5 team.

It will be interesting to come back to this when the regular season is over, but it doesn‚Äôt seem like the worst field considering which teams are participating.

title: Zubimendi hints Merino‚Äôs season is over, World Cup in doubt
description: Arsenal fans face growing uncertainty over Mikel Merino‚Äôs season after comments from Martin Zubimendi raised doubts about whether the midfielder will be fit in time for the World Cup.Photo by Gabrie...
fullText:
Merino is facing a prolonged spell on the sidelines after suffering a foot injury that requires surgery, with the length of his expected absence still unclear.

Speaking after Arsenal‚Äôs Carabao Cup semi final win over Chelsea on Tuesday night, Mikel Arteta confirmed the seriousness of the issue, telling beIN SPORTS, ‚ÄúWith Merino, yeah, he‚Äôs going to be out for months unfortunately, with a foot injury.‚Äù

While Arsenal have indicated they remain hopeful Merino could return before the end of the season, Zubimendi‚Äôs remarks following the same match suggested the situation may be more uncertain.

Speaking about his international team mate, he said, ‚ÄúWell, he‚Äôs in pain. He‚Äôs a very professional person, who takes care of himself and always thinks about what‚Äôs best for the club. I know he‚Äôs the one who‚Äôs most hurt, but the damage his injury has done to the club is significant.‚Äù

Zubimendi went on to acknowledge the challenge Merino faces in trying to recover in time for international duty. He said, ‚ÄúWell, he seems fine, but everyone‚Äôs different when they get home. I understand it‚Äôs harder than it looks. I know he‚Äôll do everything he can to make it [to the national team], and if he doesn‚Äôt, it‚Äôll be a real shame. We‚Äôll see what happens.‚Äù

With the World Cup due to begin on 11 June, just over two weeks after the Premier League season ends on 24 May and six days after the Champions League final, the margin for recovery is tight.

Zubimendi‚Äôs comments underline concerns that Merino‚Äôs campaign may already be over, despite Arsenal‚Äôs hope that he could yet return before the season concludes.

title: Jets finally have second coordinator interview with Frank Reich
description: The Jets had their awaited second interview with Frank Reich.
fullText:
The New York Jets have completed their expected third and final second interview with a candidate for their vacant offensive coordinator position on Aaron Glenn's coaching staff.

The team has announced that former NFL head coach Frank Reich spoke with the team again:

We've completed an in-person interview with Frank Reich for our offensive coordinator position.

‚Äî New York Jets (@nyjets) February 4, 2026

Reich, 64, is currently a senior adviser with Stanford University.

Reich was the Carolina Panthers' head coach in 2023. Reich also had a five-year stint as the head coach of the Colts (2018-22).

In addition to Reich, the two other candidates considered finalists for the Jets' offensive coordinator role are longtime NFL OC Greg Roman and former Miami Dolphins quarterbacks coach Darrell Bevell.

Jets Wire will continue to provide updates throughout the 2026 offseason.

This article originally appeared on Jets Wire: Jets finally have second coordinator interview with Frank Reich

title: Blessed & Honored: Kemon Spells Commits To Georgia
description: National Signing Day Is Here 15 years ago, this day would have been massive. But now with the early NSD period in December, the first Wednesday in February is just a footnote in the recruiting calendar. Penn State‚Äôs class is basically, with four-star WR Samson Gash expected to stick with his commitment to Michigan State [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
15 years ago, this day would have been massive. But now with the early NSD period in December, the first Wednesday in February is just a footnote in the recruiting calendar. Penn State‚Äôs class is basically, with four-star WR Samson Gash expected to stick with his commitment to Michigan State despite a late push from the new Penn State staff. Here‚Äôs who the Nittany Lions will bring in in a pieced-together 2026 class:

DE Elijah Reeder (91.53 Rivals Industry Rating)
DE Jackson Ford (90.67)
QB/ATH Peyton Falzone (89.33)
CB Josiah Zayas (89.21)
DB Tyrell Chatman (88.10)
OT Mason Bandhauer (97.43)
S Bryson Williams (87.43)
S Amarion Jackson (86.80)
WR Ben Whitver (86.80)
RB D‚ÄôAnte Sheffey (86.43)
QB Kase Evans (86.13)
LB Keian Kaiser (85.83)
OT Pete Eglitis (85.17)
S Christian Askew (83.53)
P Lucas Tenbrock (81.57)

In recent weeks, it appeared that Penn State was surging for five-star PA running back Kemon Spell. The one-time Penn State commit had Rivals recruitnik Steve Wiltfong even put in a prediction for the Nittany Lions.

Spell was set to visit Happy Valley on January 24th, but the visit never materialized. He then went to Georgia this past weekend, and made the call for the Bulldogs.

üö®BREAKINGüö® 5-star RB Kemon Spell has committed to Georgia, @Hayesfawcett3 reportsüê∂

Spell is the No. 1 RB in the 2027 class. 

Read: https://t.co/z43NKiTfeU pic.twitter.com/n6XyvukNvd

‚Äî Rivals (@Rivals) February 2, 2026

While I get the sense that Spell‚Äôs recruitment isn‚Äôt over ‚Äî I personally would be surprised if he doesn‚Äôt take official visits over the summer ‚Äî this is certainly a kick to the nads for Penn State. Landing Spell as commitment No. 1 in the 2027 class would have been a huge statement for Matt Campbell & Co., but we‚Äôll see how they pivot from here.

Five-Star OL Maxwell Hiller (Coatesville, PA)

Big time prospect from Just-Outside-Philly that will be a major priority for the new staff. Also, his brother is a five-star basketball prospect in the 2028 class. Not that Penn State will be involved in that, but what kind of freaky genetics do their parents have that they have a son who is a five-star offensive lineman in football and another son who is a five-star wing in basketball?

Four-Star OL Will Slagle (Grinnell, IA)

Slagle is a former Iowa State commit, which obviously means good things for Penn State‚Äôs chances.

DL Cahron Wheeler (Baltimore, MD)

No ranking for Wheeler just yet, but Georgia and Ohio State offers highlight the type of prospect he‚Äôll be.

Three-Star DT Stanley Montgomery (Philadelphia, PA)

Was a former Syracuse commit who backed off his ‚ÄòCuse pledge last night. Very good high school wrestler as well.

Three-Star LB Blake Betton (Shakopee, MN)

More Midwest vibes given the staff‚Äôs connections out there. Intriguing kid at 6-foot-3, 205 pounds as he grows into his body and moves from safety prospect to full-time linebacker.

Three-Star CB Ka‚Äôron Ceaser (Penns Grove, NJ)

Plays at Winslows Township where Bill Belton is the head man and is quietly building a really good high school program.

On top of Junior Day visits, the staff has already begun locking in official visits for the summer. I‚Äôll put together a full list in due time, but some notable names that announced their Penn State OV this week:

Four-Star DB Malakai Taufoou (San Mateo, CA)

Three-Star CB Zach Gleason Jr. (Pittsburgh, PA)

CB Rico Jackson (Upper Marlboro, MD)

title: Why Ruben Amorim hasn‚Äôt said goodbye to Man United fans ‚Äì and how Michael Carrick is involved
description: It‚Äôs been close to a month since Ruben Amorim was dismissed by Manchester United, and the former head coach still hasn‚Äôt spoken publicly about his exit. Amorim‚Äôs downfall came quickly.
fullText:
It‚Äôs been close to a month since Ruben Amorim was dismissed by Manchester United, and the former head coach still hasn‚Äôt spoken publicly about his exit.

Amorim‚Äôs downfall came quickly. The Portuguese manager lashed out at the club‚Äôs hierarchy over a single weekend, leading to his dismissal.

His final game in charge was a 1-1 draw with Leeds United. The following morning, Ineos made the decision to sack him, ending his tenure after 14 months.

Despite poor results, fans had shown real support for Amorim, who suffered through a dreadful Premier League campaign and the club‚Äôs lowest-ever finish in 2024/25. Still, it‚Äôs been surprising how little has come from him since leaving Old Trafford.

Amorim‚Äôs relationship with the club broke down quickly, and he left with no intention of repairing any ties. But fans never lost faith in him, and his connection with the supporters remained strong throughout.

The Daily Mail now reports that Amorim has decided to hold off on speaking about his departure from United until after the season has finished.

He apparently wants to avoid distracting new manager Michael Carrick, who is still settling into the role.

Carrick has started well, matching Amorim‚Äôs longest winning run of three games early in his tenure.

Amorim left United frustrated, taking aim at sporting director Jason Wilcox on his way out.

Wilcox is said to have been involved in tactical decisions during Amorim‚Äôs tenure, which the Portuguese manager reportedly felt overstepped boundaries.

While Amorim is holding off on his farewell until season‚Äôs end, he might use that moment to shed light on the events leading up to his dismissal.

There were reports of a heated exchange between Amorim and Wilcox just before the Leeds game, and fans may soon get more clarity on what happened behind closed doors.

Throughout his time as head coach, Amorim was known for his honesty, and there‚Äôs no reason to expect that will change now that he‚Äôs gone.

title: Livingston v Falkirk: Pick of the stats
description: Livingston have only won one of their six previous top-flight meetings with Falkirk (D2 L3), though that was their first league win of this season, a 3-1 home victory back in August.  Only one of the last six Scottish Premiership matches between two newly promoted clubs has been won by the home side (two draws, three away wins), although that was Livingston's 3-1 win over Falkirk in August this season.  Livingston are winless in their last 15 midweek (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) games in the Scottish Premiership (D6 L9) since a 2-1 victory over Aberdeen in November 2022.
fullText:
Livingston have only won one of their six previous top-flight meetings with Falkirk (D2 L3), though that was their first league win of this season, a 3-1 home victory back in August.

Only one of the last six Scottish Premiership matches between two newly promoted clubs has been won by the home side (two draws, three away wins), although that was Livingston's 3-1 win over Falkirk in August this season.

Livingston are winless in their last 15 midweek (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) games in the Scottish Premiership (D6 L9) since a 2-1 victory over Aberdeen in November 2022.

Falkirk have failed to win all four of their midweek (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday) league games this season (D2 L2), and are winless in seven midweek matches in the top-flight overall (D4 L3) since a 1-0 victory at Aberdeen in February 2010.

Livingston have won five of their last seven Scottish Premiership games at home to newly promoted opponents (L2), including a 3-1 win over Falkirk earlier this season.

title: Bills' Josh Allen rooting for Seahawks' Sam Darnold in Super Bowl
description: Bills QB Josh Allen on Seahawks QB Sam Darnold in the Super Bowl vs. the Patriots.
fullText:
Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen is rooting for the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl 60 as they face the New England Patriots.

But not exactly for any negative Patriots reasons.

Allen is leaning into the Seahawks because of friendship. It has long been known that Seattle quarterback Sam Darnold is one of Allen's close friends.

"I love Sam Darnold, that's one of my good buddies," Allen told CBS Sports. "I will be watching, I will be rooting him on."

Allen and Darnold were both part of the same NFL draft class in 2018.

For more from Allen, see the attached clip below:

"I love Sam Darnold, [he] is one of my good buddies. I will be rooting him on."@JoshAllenQB is excited to watch his good friend Sam Darnold play in the Super Bowl.

Watch the full interview with Josh Allen and @Hassel_Chris on the CBS Sports YouTube channel.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/fixgavnQQ5

‚Äî NFL on CBS üèà (@NFLonCBS) February 4, 2026

title: Rangers v Kilmarnock: Pick of the stats
description: Rangers have won each of their last nine home league meetings with Kilmarnock by an aggregate score of 25-4; it's their longest ongoing home league winning streak versus any current Scottish Premiership opponent.  Kilmarnock have lost 13 of their last 15 league matches against Rangers (W2), including their last four in a row all while conceding 3+ goals since a 1-0 victory in October 2024.  Rangers have won each of their last five home league games, after having only won four of their previous 13 beforehand (D5 L4).
fullText:
Rangers have won each of their last nine home league meetings with Kilmarnock by an aggregate score of 25-4; it's their longest ongoing home league winning streak versus any current Scottish Premiership opponent.

Kilmarnock have lost 13 of their last 15 league matches against Rangers (W2), including their last four in a row all while conceding 3+ goals since a 1-0 victory in October 2024.

Rangers have won each of their last five home league games, after having only won four of their previous 13 beforehand (D5 L4).

Kilmarnock are winless in their last nine away games in the Scottish Premiership (D3 L6) since a 2-0 win at Dundee United in September.

Kilmarnock boss Neil McCann has managed three away league games against Rangers in his career and lost them all by an aggregate score of 12-1, each coming with Dundee from September 2017 to September 2018.

title: Texas A&M remains 100% healthy before facing Alabama on Wednesday
description: Texas A&M, outside of forward Mackenzie Mgbako, is entirely healthy before facing Alabama, while the Crimson Tide are also in good shape.
fullText:
Texas A&M (17-4, 7-1 SEC) still sits atop the SEC standings after defeating Georgia on the road 92-77, and with seven wins in conference play, the Aggies likely need at least three more victories to solidify their NCAA Tournament chances as an at-large bid. Set to face Alabama on the road, the Crimson Tide is desperate to protect home court after falling to Florida on the road 100-77.

Entering Wednesday's road test, first-year head coach Bucky McMillan spent Monday praising his team rather than spending both the pregame press conference and Aggie basketball hour discussing Alabama's roster, especially center Charles Bediako, who will be available on Wednesday amid his ongoing eligibility battle. After shooting 45% from the field and 38% from beyond the arc, the Aggies will need to continue outshooting opponents to keep the win streak alive.

However, Alabama has nearly matched Texas A&M from three-point range over the past two games, making an average of 14 threes per game compared to the Aggies' 15.

Health-wise, outside of Indiana transfer forward Mackenzie Mgbako, McMillan's roster is entirely healthy heading into Wednesday night, and according to the initial injury report, Alabama will be without three players, while forward Taylor Bol Bowen (7.7 PPG, 5.4 RPG), who was injured against Florida, is listed as "questionable" with a 50% chance to play.

Even if Bol Bowen doesn't play, Texas A&M will face a healthy Alabama squad led by star guard Labaron Philon Jr., who is averaging 21.6 points per game, shooting 51% from the field, and 38% from beyond the arc.

The SEC Student-Athlete Availability Report ahead of Texas A&M at Alabama tomorrow night: pic.twitter.com/M8t9COrbYQ

‚Äî TexAgs (@TexAgs) February 4, 2026

title: Tianqi Lithium Reprices Convertible Bond Sale After Blunder

title: South Korea Markets Dollar Bond With US Investments on Horizon
description: South Korea is offering dollar-denominated bonds, an effort to bolster its foreign exchange reserves amid global uncertainties and massive investments pledged under a US trade deal.
fullText: MarketsBy Haram Lim, Susie Kang, and Harry SuhartonoSaveSouth Korea is offering dollar-denominated bonds, an effort to bolster its foreign exchange reserves amid global uncertainties and massive investments pledged under a US trade deal.The government is planning benchmark-sized notes in three and five-year maturities, according to people familiar with the matter. Initial pricing for the notes was set at around 13 basis points and about 16 basis points, respectively, over comparable US Treasury yields, they said.

title: Equinor Sees Giant Sverdrup Oil Field‚Äôs Output Declining in 2026
description: Equinor expects oil output from its Johan Sverdrup oil field, the largest source of European supply growth in the last decade, to fall this year.
fullText: IndustriesEnergyBy Kari Lundgren and Alex LongleySaveEquinor expects oil output from its Johan Sverdrup oil field, the largest source of European supply growth in the last decade, to fall this year. Production will decline by somewhere between 10% and 20%, Chief Executive Officer Anders Opedal said at a media briefing on Wednesday. Exports from the field averaged 712,000 barrels a day last year, according to loading programs compiled by Bloomberg.

title: Novo CEO Says Volumes to Compensate for Price Decreases
description: Novo Nordisk Chief Executive Officer Mike Doustdar talks about the company's outlook as it faces headwinds on its main obesity and diabetes drugs and its shares plunged. title: Claude Is a Space to Think
description: Anthropic explains why Claude will remain ad-free‚Äîhow advertising incentives conflict with building a genuinely helpful AI assistant users can trust.
fullText:
There are many good places for advertising. A conversation with Claude is not one of them.

Advertising drives competition, helps people discover new products, and allows services like email and social media to be offered for free. We‚Äôve run our own ad campaigns, and our AI models have, in turn, helped many of our customers in the advertising industry.

But including ads in conversations with Claude would be incompatible with what we want Claude to be: a genuinely helpful assistant for work and for deep thinking.

We want Claude to act unambiguously in our users‚Äô interests. So we‚Äôve made a choice: Claude will remain ad-free. Our users won‚Äôt see ‚Äúsponsored‚Äù links adjacent to their conversations with Claude; nor will Claude‚Äôs responses be influenced by advertisers or include third-party product placements our users did not ask for.

When people use search engines or social media, they‚Äôve come to expect a mixture of organic and sponsored content. Filtering signal from noise is part of the interaction.

Conversations with AI assistants are meaningfully different. The format is open-ended; users often share context and reveal more than they would in a search query. This openness is part of what makes conversations with AI valuable, but it‚Äôs also what makes them susceptible to influence in ways that other digital products are not.

Our analysis of conversations with Claude (conducted in a way that keeps all data private and anonymous) shows that an appreciable portion involve topics that are sensitive or deeply personal‚Äîthe kinds of conversations you might have with a trusted advisor. Many other uses involve complex software engineering tasks, deep work, or thinking through difficult problems. The appearance of ads in these contexts would feel incongruous‚Äîand, in many cases, inappropriate.

We still have much to learn about the impact of AI models on the people who use them. Early research suggests both benefits‚Äîlike people finding support they couldn‚Äôt access elsewhere‚Äîand risks, including the potential for models to reinforce harmful beliefs in vulnerable users. Introducing advertising incentives at this stage would add another level of complexity. Our understanding of how models translate the goals we set them into specific behaviors is still developing; an ad-based system could therefore have unpredictable results.

Being genuinely helpful is one of the core principles of Claude‚Äôs Constitution, the document that describes our vision for Claude‚Äôs character and guides how we train the model. An advertising-based business model would introduce incentives that could work against this principle.

Consider a concrete example. A user mentions they‚Äôre having trouble sleeping. An assistant without advertising incentives would explore the various potential causes‚Äîstress, environment, habits, and so on‚Äîbased on what might be most insightful to the user. An ad-supported assistant has an additional consideration: whether the conversation presents an opportunity to make a transaction. These objectives may often align‚Äîbut not always. And, unlike a list of search results, ads that influence a model‚Äôs responses may make it difficult to tell whether a given recommendation comes with a commercial motive or not. Users shouldn‚Äôt have to second-guess whether an AI is genuinely helping them or subtly steering the conversation towards something monetizable.

Even ads that don‚Äôt directly influence an AI model‚Äôs responses and instead appear separately within the chat window would compromise what we want Claude to be: a clear space to think and work. Such ads would also introduce an incentive to optimize for engagement‚Äîfor the amount of time people spend using Claude and how often they return. These metrics aren‚Äôt necessarily aligned with being genuinely helpful. The most useful AI interaction might be a short one, or one that resolves the user‚Äôs request without prompting further conversation.

We recognize that not all advertising implementations are equivalent. More transparent or opt-in approaches‚Äîwhere users explicitly choose to see sponsored content‚Äîmight avoid some of the concerns outlined above. But the history of ad-supported products suggests that advertising incentives, once introduced, tend to expand over time as they become integrated into revenue targets and product development, blurring boundaries that were once more clear-cut. We‚Äôve chosen not to introduce these dynamics into Claude.

Anthropic is focused on businesses, developers, and helping our users flourish. Our business model is straightforward: we generate revenue through enterprise contracts and paid subscriptions, and we reinvest that revenue into improving Claude for our users. This is a choice with tradeoffs, and we respect that other AI companies might reasonably reach different conclusions.

Expanding access to Claude is central to our public benefit mission, and we want to do it without selling our users‚Äô attention or data to advertisers. To that end, we‚Äôve brought AI tools and training to educators in over 60 countries, begun national AI education pilots with multiple governments, and made Claude available to nonprofits at a significant discount. We continue to invest in our smaller models so that our free offering remains at the frontier of intelligence, and we may consider lower-cost subscription tiers and regional pricing where there is clear demand for it. Should we need to revisit this approach, we‚Äôll be transparent about our reasons for doing so.

AI will increasingly interact with commerce, and we look forward to supporting this in ways that help our users. We‚Äôre particularly interested in the potential of agentic commerce, where Claude acts on a user‚Äôs behalf to handle a purchase or booking end to end. And we‚Äôll continue to build features that enable our users to find, compare, or buy products, connect with businesses, and more‚Äîwhen they choose to do so.

We‚Äôre also exploring more ways to make Claude a focused space to be at your most productive. Users can already connect third-party tools they use for work‚Äîlike Figma, Asana, and Canva‚Äîand interact with them directly within Claude. We expect to introduce many more useful integrations and expand this toolkit over time.

All third-party interactions will be grounded in the same overarching design principle: they should be initiated by the user (where the AI is working for them) rather than an advertiser (where the AI is working, at least in part, for someone else). Today, whether someone asks Claude to research running shoes, compare mortgage rates, or recommend a restaurant for a special occasion, Claude‚Äôs only incentive is to give a helpful answer. We‚Äôd like to preserve that.

We want our users to trust Claude to help them keep thinking‚Äîabout their work, their challenges, and their ideas.

Our experience of using the internet has made it easy to assume that advertising on the products we use is inevitable. But open a notebook, pick up a well-crafted tool, or stand in front of a clean chalkboard, and there are no ads in sight.

We think Claude should work the same way.
